page.title: 18CLUBS IN WEST CAMBRIDGESHIRE
page.content: The main organisation in Stow Longa is the small but active Women's Institute, which meets each month at the home of one of the members. It offers a varied programme of talks and demonstrations, as well as the opportunity for members to participate in competitions and classes at county level. A small youth club, which meets in the changing room at Catworth playing field, is well supported by children from the village. Many also attend Brownie, Cub, Guide and Scout meetings at Brington or Kimbolton. A number of adults belong to clubs outside the area: Catworth Women's Institute offers a similar programme to the one at Stow Longa, while the Floral, Local History and Music Societies at Kimbolton are also popular.
